title: Steiner Care Home
description: The residents at William Blake House are young adults with learning disabilities. We offer accommodation and activities where the residents can live, learn and work with others in healthy social relationships based on mutual care and respect.

It aims to investigate and codify the spiritual world with the same clarity and precison as the natural sciences achieve in their study of the physical world. Furthermore, its teachings are applicable in many areas of life including care, education, architecture, and medicine. Anthroposophy holds that the human being is a complex whole comprised of both material and spiritual components. While mysticism lacks the rigour and precision required to satisfactorily investigate the nature of reality, and conventional science remains largely unwilling to consider explorations of the world within, anthroposophy stands between the two with its clear and holistic approach.
